item.title: An Introduction to H2O Using R
item.description: 1. Introduction In this post we discuss the H2O machine learning platform. We talk about what H2O is, and how to get started with it, using R. 2. What is H2O? The definition found on H2O’s Github page is a lot to take in, especially if you’re just starting out with H2O: “H2O is an in-memory platform for distributed, scalable machine learning. H2O uses familiar interfaces like R, Python, Scala, Java, JSON and the Flow notebook/web interface, and works seamlessly with big data technologies like Hadoop and Spark.
